<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObject = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String ob = resultObject.getString("0B");
String oy = resultObject.getString("0Y");
String oneX = resultObject.getString("1X");
responseView.setText("OB: " + ob + " OY: " + oy + " 1X: " + oneX);
<<<explanation>>>: To separate the "Result" objects, you need to retrieve the "Result" object from the JSON response using `json.getJSONObject("Result")`. Then, you can use `getString()` method to get the values of each object.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObject = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String obValue = resultObject.getString("0B");
String obyValue = resultObject.getString("0Y");
String oneXValue = resultObject.getString("1X");
responseView.setText("Status: " + status + " Message: " + message + " Result 0B: " + obValue + " Result 0Y: " + obyValue + " Result 1X: " + oneXValue);
<<<explanation>>>: To access the "Result" object, you can use the getJSONObject() method of the JSONObject class. Then, you can use the getString() method to get the values of the individual keys ("0B", "0Y", "1X") within the "Result" object.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObj = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String ob = resultObj.getString("0B");
String obResult = resultObj.getString(ob);
responseView.setText("OB Result: " + obResult);
<<<explanation>>>: After getting the "Result" object from the JSON response, you can use the getJSONObject() method to get the nested objects within it. In this case, you can get the "0B" object and its corresponding value using getString().

<<<api>>>: JSONObject.getJSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObject = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String ob = resultObject.getString("0B");
String oy = resultObject.getString("0Y");
String oneX = resultObject.getString("1X");
responseView.setText("OB: " + ob + " OY: " + oy + " 1X: " + oneX);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getJSONObject method of the JSONObject class to get the "Result" object. Then, you can use the getString method to get the values of each key in the "Result" object.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObj = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String ob = resultObj.getString("0B");
String oy = resultObj.getString("0Y");
String oneX = resultObj.getString("1X");
responseView.setText("OB: " + ob + ", OY: " + oy + ", 1X: " + oneX);
<<<explanation>>>: To separate the "Result" objects, you can use the getJSONObject() method to get the nested JSONObject for "Result". Then, you can use getString() method to retrieve the values for each key in "Result" (0B, 0Y, 1X) and use them as separate objects.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObject = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String ob = resultObject.getString("0B");
String oy = resultObject.getString("0Y");
String ix = resultObject.getString("1X");
responseView.setText("OB: " + ob + "\nOY: " + oy + "\nIX: " + ix);
<<<explanation>>>: To separate the "Result" objects, you can use the getJSONObject() method of the JSONObject class to get the "Result" object. Then, you can use getString() method to get the values of each object.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObj = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String obValue = resultObj.getString("0B");
String obResult = resultObj.getString(obValue);
responseView.setText("Status: " + status + " Message: " + message + " Result: " + obResult);
<<<explanation>>>: To separate the "Result" objects, you can use the getJSONObject() method to get the JSON object for "Result". Then, you can use getString() to get the values for each key in the "Result" object. In this case, you can get the value for "0B" and use it to get the corresponding result value.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject, JSONObject.keys()
<<<code>>>: JSONObject json = new JSONObject(response);
String status = json.getString("Status");
String message = json.getString("Message");
JSONObject result = json.getJSONObject("Result");
Iterator<String> keys = result.keys();
while(keys.hasNext()) {
    String key = keys.next();
    String value = result.getString(key);
    // Use key and value as needed
}
<<<explanation>>>: After getting the "Result" object as a JSONObject, you can use the keys() method to get an Iterator of all the keys in the object. Then, you can iterate over the keys and get the corresponding values using getString(key).

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObject = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String ob = resultObject.getString("0B");
String obResult = resultObject.getString(ob);
responseView.setText("Status: " + status + " Message: " + message + " Result: " + obResult);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getJSONObject method to get the "Result" object from the JSON response. Then, you can use getString method to get the values of specific keys within the "Result" object. In this case, you can get the value of "0B" key and use it to get the corresponding result value.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONObject resultObject = json.getJSONObject("Result");
String obResult = resultObject.getString("0B");
String oyResult = resultObject.getString("0Y");
String ixResult = resultObject.getString("1X");
responseView.setText("Status: " + status + " Message: " + message + " Result: " + "0B: " + obResult + " 0Y: " + oyResult + " 1X: " + ixResult);
<<<explanation>>>: To access the values of the "Result" object, you need to first get the JSONObject for "Result" using json.getJSONObject("Result"). Then, you can use getString() method to get the values for each key in the "Result" object.
